answers.answer: "indicator of diabetes,liver or kidney issues or perhaps something else? "An infectious disease can elevate glucose levels. Going by your labs it seems your doctor is looking closely at your kidney functions. I didn't see posted a Chemistry Panel for you your liver so don't know why you're asking. It's quite possible your doctor may order a lab for Hepatitis A, B, and C, and possibly follow-up with images [MRI, CT Scan, or Ultrasound] to help narrow down the cause of your discomfort. This is something you will need to discuss in-depth with him/her. Good luck

question: 43 yr old female lab results low BUN/creatine,low total protein,high potassium,high Seg,low MCHC,high glucose Is this an indicator of diabetes,liver or kidney issues or perhaps something else?
title: lab reults inquiry
